p: The dried plant samples consisting of the leaves of M. spicata, rhizomes of Z. officinale, bark of C. zeylanicum, and peels of C. sinensis were provided from the Herbal Medicine Market and identified at the Department of Pharmacognosy, Faculty of Pharmacy, Tabriz University of Medical Sciences, Tabriz, Iran. The different plant samples were thoroughly powdered and sieved. The powders were mixed with 5 (250 mg): 4 (200 mg): 3 (150 mg): 2 (100 mg) weight ratios of spearmint, ginger, cinnamon, and C. sinensis, respectively. Finally, obtained powder was used for preparation of 700 mg capsules.
